member.name: T:CaliperForm.Connection
member.summary: Connection to the mapping server. Use this class to connect to one GISDK COM application, execute functions and macros, create map images and select geographic data. This class include methods for converting data types between the GISDK environment and the .NET environment.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new instance.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.SetProperties
member.summary: Set default instance properties if they are not set yet.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetNamedInstance
member.summary: Determine the named instance for this connection, based on the value of _Instance Side effect: Will set the appropriate value for ServerName

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.Open
member.summary: Open a connection to a Caliper COM mapping server object. Always call this method before using the COM mapping server. Returns true if connection is successful, false otherwise.
member.returns: Returns true if connection to Maptitude, TransCAD or TransModeler is open, else return false. This method may raise an exception of type "Unauthorized Access Exception" or "Access is Denied". To avoid an access exception, you need to verify the security tab in the DCOM configuration settings for the "ProductName.AutomationServer*" objects via the Windows DCOM Config tools.

example.code:
Dim NumFilled As Integer = 0 Dim DataSet As New System.Data.DataSet("Gisdk") Dim DataAdapter As CaliperForm.GisdkDataAdapter Dim ViewFile As String Dim ViewName As String Dim MyTable As System.Data.DataTable Dim Gisdk As CaliperForm.Connection
Gisdk = New CaliperForm.Connection() Gisdk.MappingServer = "TransCAD" Gisdk.MappingServer = "Maptitude" Gisdk.MappingServer = "TransModeler" Gisdk.InstanceNumber = 2 Gisdk.Open() ViewFile = Gisdk.MapPath("Tutorial/Customer.dbf") If Not IsNothing(ViewFile) Then ViewName = Gisdk.GetView(ViewFile) DataAdapter = New GisdkDataAdapter(Gisdk, ViewName) DataAdapter.TableName = "Customers" DataAdapter.RowsPerFill = 10 While (DataAdapter.SetRows > 0) AndAlso (DataAdapter.RowsLeft > 0) NumFilled = DataAdapter.Fill(DataSet) DataAdapter.CurrentRow = DataAdapter.NextRow End While End If Gisdk.Close()

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Open a connection to the GISDK without a UI, and write any error message to error_log_file
member.returns: True if the connection can be established
member.remarks: Throws an exception if starting up the GISDK fails for any reason

members.member: If desktop client, Context must be nothing, and call the function GetProgram. If web client and ASP.NET, then Context must be a valid reference, and call the macro "Get Web Program" If web client and ASP, then Context will be nothing, and call macro "Get Web Program"

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetServerObject
member.summary: Connect to ProductName.AutomationServer or ProductName.AutomationServerN
member.returns: True if ServerObject is a valid handle to the COM object, false otherwise

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.TableToArray(System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Translate a Microsoft.NET Hashtable object into an option array that can be passed as an argument to a Gisdk function or macro. This method will translate nested hashtables to a valid option array.
member.param: Input Hashtable or CaliperForm.Collection
member.returns: Output Gisdk option array with the format: { { "Key1" , value1 } , { "Key2" , value2 } , ... }

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetSystemType(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a valid Microsoft.NET System.type for a Gisdk type name. Supports string, double and integer types.
member.param: A Gisdk type name: "string", "integer", "real", "double", "float", "short" , or "long".
member.returns: A valid Microsoft.NET System.type: System.String, System.Int32, or System.Double.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.ArrayToTable(System.Object)
member.summary: Translate a Gisdk option array into a valid Microsoft.NET hashtable. This method will not translate nested option array values to hashtables.
member.param: Input Gisdk option array with the format: { { "Key1" , value1 } , { "Key2" , value2 } , ... }
member.returns: A valid Microsoft.NET Hashtable object

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.ObjectToArray(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Translate a Gisdk array to a valid .NET array of the correct type
member.param: Input Gisdk array
Desired type of each array item: one of "integer" , "double" , "boolean" , or "string".
member.returns: The desired .NET array

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetProperty(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Return a property value for one of the Caliper COM objects defined in the Maptitude and TransCAD servers (e.g. Coord, Scope, Circle...)
member.param: The target object (e.g: a scope, a coordinate, or a circle)
The property name (e.g: "Longitude", "Latitude" , "Center", "Width", etc..)
member.returns: The property object if success, else Nothing if failure.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.SetProperty(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set a property value for one of the Caliper COM objects defined in the Maptitude and TransCAD servers (e.g. Coord, Scope, Circle).
member.param: The target object (e.g: a scope, a coordinate, or a circle)
The property name (e.g: "Longitude", "Latitude" , "Center", etc..)
The desired property value (e.g.; a longitude, a latitude, a center coordinate, a radius...)
member.returns: True if success, False if Failures

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.DoFunction(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes a GISDK function. For example: Gisdk.DoFunction("GetProgram") returns an array with the program information.
member.param: Function name.
Optional input arguments. See the GISDK online manual for the list of functions and the required input arguments.
member.returns: The object returned by executing the function. This method throws an exception if the GISDK function returns an error.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.DoMacro(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes a GISDK macro in a compiled module (UIDatabase).
member.param: Name of the macro in the UIDatabase
Compiled GISDK Module. Use a partial path to indicate a module in the Caliper product program directory.
Input arguments required by the macro.
member.returns: The object returned by the macro. This method throws an exception if a function called inside the macro returns an error.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.CreateObject(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an object from a GISDK class in a compiled module (UIDatabase).
member.param: Name of the class in the UIDatabase
Compiled GISDK Module. Use a partial path to indicate a module in the Caliper product program directory.
Input arguments required by the class.
member.returns: The new object instance. This method throws an exception if a function called inside the init macro of the class returns an error.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetMap(System.String)
member.summary: Open or get a map in the current workspace. If the map is already open, it returns its name, else it tries to open the map file. This method may return Nothing if the GISDK fails to open the map because some of the layers speficied in the map file cannot be found.
member.param: Map file name. Can be a partial path, relative to the program folder or the application folder, or an absolute path.
member.returns: The name of the open map, or Nothing if the map cannot be open because one or more layers cannot be found.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetMap(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Open a map and set the map scope.
member.param: Input map file
Desired map scope
member.returns: The workspace map name if succesfull, else nothing

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.StringToScope(System.String)
member.summary: Translate a propertly formatted string into a valid GISDK scope object using the current map units.
member.param: A string formatted as: "CenterLongitude|CenterLatitude|ScopeWidth|ScopeHeight". The decimal point in ScopeWidth and ScopeHeight must be indicated with a period, independently of the Windows regional settings.
member.returns: A valid GISDK scope object.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.ScopeToString(System.Object)
member.summary: Translate a GISDK scope object into a string.
member.param: A valid GISDK scope object in the current map units.
member.returns: A string formatted as: "CenterLongitude|CenterLatitude|ScopeWidth|ScopeHeight". CenterLongitude and CenterLatitude are integers (millions of degrees). ScopeWidth and ScopeHeight are real. The decimal point in ScopeWidth and ScopeHeight is always indicated with a period, independently of the computer Windows regional settings.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetFieldTypes(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Get the list of field specs and field types for a given list of field names. If the input view name is mappable to a geographic layer, this method will search for all mappable fields, including all tables joined to the layer.
member.param: Input view name
Array with list of field names
member.returns: Nothing if one or more of the input field names cannot be found. Else, it returns an array of arrays with format: { { FieldSpec , FieldType } }, where FieldSpec is a string of type "ViewName.FieldName" and FieldType is a valid Gisdk variant type name (string, integer, or double)

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetLayer(System.String)
member.summary: Get the name of a layer that is open in the workspace. The layer must already be in the workspace in one of the open maps.
member.param: Input layer name.
member.returns: The actual name of the layer found, e.g. "Layer Name", or "Layer Name:1", or "Layer Name:2", etc...

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetLayer(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the name of a layer contained in a map. The map must be already open in the workspace.
member.param: Input layer name
Input map name
member.returns: The actual name of the layer found, e.g. "Layer Name", or "Layer Name:1", or "Layer Name:2", etc...

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.MapPath(System.String)
member.summary: Map a partial file path to a full path, and checks that files exists, using the search path specified in the Caliper program under Edit Preferences - System - Search Path. Returns the complete path of the file found, else returns nothing.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.GetView(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Open or get a table in the current workspace. If the table is already open, this method returns the name of the existing view. If the table is not open, this method will open the table file and add its view to the current workspace.
member.param: Input dataview file (with extension .dvw) or binary table.
Whether to open the table for writing. Defaults to False.
member.returns: The name of the corresponding view in the current workspace. Returns Nothing or thows an exception if the table cannot be open.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.SaveSchema(System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Save the XML schema of a data view to a file.
member.param: Input view name
List of fields to include in the XML schema
Output XML File
member.returns: The number of records contained in the view.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.SaveDataSet(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Save a selection set to an XML dataset file. The output file will contain the schema and the data. See also: GisdkDataAdapter.
member.param: Input view
Input set
List of columns to store to the XML dataset
Output XML file. If the file extension is xsd it will output the XML schema only.
If Verbose is greater than zero, this method will display progress status in the Gisdk environment while processing the data.
member.returns: The number of rows written to the output XML file. Returns -1 if a run-time exception occured.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.IsConnected
member.summary: Returns true if we are connected to the mapping server.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Connection.Close
member.summary: Close the connection to the GISDK mapping server object. Always call this method when done with the current connection.

members.member: Every 10 or so web page requests, clean up the temporary output folder of images that are older than three hours.

member.name: P:CaliperForm.Connection.InstanceNumber
member.summary: Get or set the COM server instance number.
member.value: A number between 0 and 256. Defaults to 0
member.returns: A number between 0 and 256
member.remarks: Instance 0 corresponds to ProductName.AutomationServer, istance 1 corresponds to ProductName.AutomationServer2, and so on...

member.name: P:CaliperForm.Connection.MappingServer
member.summary: Mapping server name. Can be either "TransCAD", "Maptitude", "TransCADEngine" , "TransModeler", "TransModelerEngine" , "TransModeler SE" or "TransModeler SEEngine"

member.name: P:CaliperForm.Connection.Gisdk
member.summary: Returns instance of CaliperForm.Gisdk for calling GISDK functions and methods using a dynamic interface.

member.name: P:CaliperForm.Connection.ServerVersion
member.summary: Mapping server name version. Can be "" or ".1.0" or ".2.0" etc

member.name: P:CaliperForm.Connection.CloseOnError
member.summary: Automatically close the connection if a run-time exception is thrown (defaults to True).
member.returns: True if close the connection if a run-time exception is thrown

member.name: T:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus
member.summary: Data structure storing cumulative statistics about this mapping server. Can be used to decide whether or not the mapping server is functioning properly, if it needs to be restarted, or whether we need to redirect to other, less busy mapping servers.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.ToString
member.summary: Pretty print of this connection status.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.ToXML
member.summary: Pretty print of this connection status as an XML element.

member.summary: Max number of concurrent connections

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.MaxConnections
member.summary: Number of attempted connections

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.NumConnections
member.summary: Number of successful connections

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.MaxWaitSeconds
member.summary: Maximum ellapsed time before connecting (in seconds)

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.LastConnection
member.summary: Status of the last attempted connection

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.LastWaitSeconds
member.summary: Elapsed time for the last connection

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.LastQueueSize
member.summary: Last queue size

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.StartTime
member.summary: Time we started to collect the connection statistics

member.name: F:CaliperForm.ConnectionStatus.LastConnectionID
member.summary: Last connection ID

member.returns: A Valid .NET Dictionary object

member.summary: Translate a .NET Hashtable object into an option array that can be passed as an argument to a Gisdk function or macro. This method will translate nested hashtables to a valid option array.
member.param: Input Hashtable or CaliperForm.Collection
member.returns: Output Gisdk option array with the format: { { "Key1" , value1 } , { "Key2" , value2 } , ... }

member.param: Input object to test

member.name: T:GisdkDataAdapter
member.summary: Class for mapping GISDK dataviews and selection sets to ADO.NET datatables. The class includes type-safe methods for filling a datatable schema and data with values coming from a GISDK view or selection set, methods for updating a GISDK dataview with values coming from a datatable, and methods for aggregating and transposing datatables. This class implements the IDataAdapter interface, and allows you to use TransCAD and Maptitude as data sources in the same way you would use an SQL or an OLEDB data source.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new instance of the GisdkDataAdapter for the purpose of copying an SQL data table into a Caliper binary table.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.CopyToBinaryTable(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Open an SQL database connection and copy the data table into a binary file that may be opened in TransCAD, Maptitude or TransModeler This function does not require a live connection to Maptitude or TransCAD. It writes the binary file that can be open with the Gisdk later. It will fail if there is a Maptitude or TransCAD process that has the files currently open.
member.param: An instance of SQL System.Data.IDbConnection (e.g.: an ODBC, Orable, SQL, or OleDB connection). The connection does not need to be open.
The query string to retrieve the data table.
The output Caliper binary file that can be added to the Gisdk workspace.
Optional output stream for reporting progress while reading the data table.
member.returns: The number of records copied to the output binary file

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.#ctor(CaliperForm.Connection)
member.summary: Create a new GisdkDataAdapter from a live Gisdk connection object without specifying an input view name.
member.param: A live Gisdk data connection

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.#ctor(CaliperForm.Connection,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of a GisdkDataAdapter that maps a GISDK data source view to a dataset table.
member.param: A live CaliperForm.Connection. The connection must be open before the GisdkDataAdapter is used, and it can be closed after you release the GisdkDataAdapter.
The name of an existing view in the GISDK workspace
Optional name of existing selection set in the source data view. Defaults to nothing.
Optional sort expression that specifies how rows are retrieved with the Fill() method. The format is: "FieldName ASC" or "FieldName DESC". Defaults to nothing to indicate natural sort order.

members.member: Verify that the record count and the first row match between Fill(), Update() and Transfer() calls to this instance of the data adapter.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.GetFillParameters
member.summary: Gets the parameters set by the user when executing a Fill() or Update() method. Not used.
member.returns: Nothing

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.FillSchema(System.Data.DataSet,System.Data.SchemaType)
member.summary: Adds a datatable to the specified dataset and configures the schema of the table to match that in the data source specified in the properties of this data adapter. The input schemaType argument is ignored. The table schema is always inferred from the source view in the GISDK workspace.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.GetDataTable(System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets or creates a datatable that matches the view|set named in this GisdkDataAdapter.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Transpose(System.Data.DataTable,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new datatable that transposes rows and columns of the input datatable.
member.param: The input datatable with one row per record and one column per field
Output datatable name. Defaults to "Table"
Output field column name. This will be the name of the first column. Defaults to "Fields"
Output column name prefix. The output columns will be named "ColumnName 1", "ColumnName 2", etc. Defaults to "Record"
Optional custom string format for each output column (e.g., "{0:c}" for currency). Default to Nothing.
member.returns: A datatable with one row per field and one column per record in the input table. All of the output values are cast to strings.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Transfer(System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates or restores a selection set ViewName|SetName with the rows corresponding to the rows in the input data table.
member.param: Input data set storing the datatable to transfer.
Set operation. One of: several, more, less and subset. Defaults to "several".
Column in the input table that corresponds to the UniqueField in the output Gisdk view. Defaults to UniqueField.
member.returns: The number of records in the output selection set.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Aggregate(System.Data.DataTable,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a new table with the aggregates (sums and counts) for selected numeric columns in the input table.
member.param: Input table to aggregate
Output table name
Input columns to add
member.returns: A new table with two rows. The first row contains the totals, and the second row contains the count of the non-zero values for each column.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Update(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Update a view in the Gisdk workspace based on values stored in the rows of a datatable. This version of Update only modifies the records that are marked as changed in the input dataset.
member.param: Input dataset object that contains the table with the records to modify
member.returns: The number of records changed in the view

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Update(System.Data.DataSet,System.Data.DataRowState)
member.summary: Update a view in the Gisdk workspace based on values stored in the rows of a datatable. This version allows you to force to add, delete or modify records based on the value of ForceRowState.
member.param: Input dataset object that contains the table with the records to modify
Added or Modified to add or modify records in the workspace, Deleted to delete records in the workspace
member.returns: The number of records changed in the view

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Fill(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Add rows from a Gisdk selection set to an ADO.NET system.data.datatable object. If the table does not exist in the input DataSetObject, it will be created. If the table already exists, the rows will be added to it. Returns the number of rows stored in the table. As a side effect, it may set the properties for RowsLeft, NextRow and CurrentRow to indicate the records that can be read by the next call to Fill().

example.code: Dim Gisdk As New CaliperForm.Connection() Dim NumFilled As Integer = 0 Dim DataSet As New DataSet("Customer Data Set") Gisdk.MappingServer = "Maptitude" Gisdk.MappingServer = "TransCAD" Gisdk.Open() Dim ViewName As String = Gisdk.GetView("Tutorial/Customer.dbf") Dim DataAdapter As New GisdkDataAdapter(Gisdk,ViewName) DataAdapter.TableName = "Customer Table" DataAdapter.RowsPerFill = 10 While (DataAdapter.SetRows > 0) AndAlso (DataAdapter.RowsLeft > 0) NumFilled = DataAdapter.Fill(DataSet) DataAdapter.CurrentRow = DataAdapter.NextRow End While Gisdk.Close()

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Fill(System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Add rows from a Gisdk selection set to an ADO.NET system.data.datatable object. This version of Fill() will add a column of distances from a coordinate. The caller can then sort the output datatable using the Distance column.
member.param: Dataset to fill
Name of the longitude field in the input view
Name of the latitude field in the input view
Distance column in the output table
Input coordinate object

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.Fill(System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add rows from a Gisdk selection set to an ADO.NET system.data.datatable object. This version of Fill() will fill a string column with the geographic scope for each row. The input view must be mappable to a geographic layer (a point, a line or an area layer).
member.param: Dataset to fill
Input view ID field name storing the unique row handle for each feature (it's usually "ID").
Output scope column name. The scopes are encoded as "CenterLongitude|CenterLatitude|Width(in current map units)|Height(in current map units)"
member.returns: The number of rows filled

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.ViewName
member.summary: Data source view name
member.returns: Name of the data source view

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.SetName
member.summary: Data source selection set name. Can be set to nothing, in which case the entire view is mapped to a data table. The selection set must already exist in the current workspace to be mapped to a data table.
member.returns: Name of the data source set

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.TableName
member.summary: Name of the dataset table.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.ViewFieldNames
member.summary: List of input field names in the data source view.
member.returns: Array of strings

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.ViewFieldTypes
member.summary: Returns an array with information about the field specs and field types stored in the input dataview. This property is not null only after a Fill() or an Update() method is called at least once.
member.returns: An array of arrays with one entry for each field in ViewFieldNames. The format for each entry is: { "FieldSpec" , "FieldType" }, where "FieldSpec" is of type: "ViewName.FieldName" and "FieldType" is a valid Gisdk column type ("string", "double", or "integer").

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.ColumnNames
member.summary: List of output dataset table column names to be mapped to the input data source fields. Defaults to the same field names used in the data source.
member.returns: Array of strings

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.RowsPerFill
member.summary: Number of rows to be read at once per Fill() method call. Must be an integer number between 1 and 500. You can call the Fill() method multiple times to fill a table with more than 500 rows.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.CurrentRow
member.summary: First row to be read by the Fill() method. Defaults to GisdkDataAdapter.FirstRow.
member.returns: A string representing a row handle in the source data view

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.CaseSensitive
member.summary: Indicates whether string comparisons within the table are case-sensitive. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.AllowDBNull
member.summary: Indicates whether null values are allowed for rows belonging to the table. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.Unique
member.summary: Indicates whether the values in each row must be unique, other than the unique field values. Defaults to False.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.UniqueField
member.summary: Field in the source data view that uniquely identifies each row. This property must be set if you want to use the Update() method to match individual rows in the source data view to individual rows in the data table. If the view is a geographic layer (DBD), this field must be the another field than the field called 'ID', because the 'ID' values are generated internally by the GISDK.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.SortField
member.summary: Field in the source data view used to retrieve rows with the Fill() method. Defaults to Nothing, unless the GisdkDataAdapter is created with a sort expression.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.SortOrder
member.summary: Sort order in the source data view used to retrieve rows with the Fill() method. Defaults to Nothing, unless the GisdkDataAdapter is created with a sort expression.
member.returns: 'Ascending' or 'Descending'

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data table allows changes once a row has been added to the table.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.MaxLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of a text column. Defaults to -1 (no limits).

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.XMLMapping
member.summary: Specifies how a data table column is serialized to XML. Defaults to System.Data.MappingType.Attribute.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.FirstRow
member.summary: Points to the first row in the input data source view selection set.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.RowsLeft
member.summary: Number of rows left to be read with the Fill() method.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.NextRow
member.summary: Row located immediately after the last row read by the Fill() method call. Can be used to set the current row before calling Fill() again.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.SetRows
member.summary: Indicates the total number of rows in the selection set mapped by this GisdkDataAdapter.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.MissingMappingAction
member.summary: Action to take when incoming data in ViewName does not have a matching table or column. Always return MissingMappingAction.Error.
member.returns: MissingMappingAction.Error

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.MissingSchemaAction
member.summary: Action to take when existing DataSet TableName schema does not match incoming data in ViewName. Always return MissingSchemaAction.Error.
member.returns: MissingSchemaAction.Error

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.TableMappings
member.summary: Returns a TableMappings collection that maps TableName to ViewName and ColumnNames to ViewFieldNames

member.name: T:GisdkDataAdapter.GisdkDataTranslator
member.summary: A class for copying database tables into native Caliper format.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.GisdkDataTranslator.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the GisdkDataTranslator object
member.param: An instance of SQL System.Data.IDbConnection (e.g.: an ODBC, Orable, SQL, or OleDB connection). The connection does not need to be open.
The query string to retrieve the data table.
The output binary file.

member.name: M:GisdkDataAdapter.GisdkDataTranslator.CopyToBinaryTable(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Open the database connection and copy the data table into the output binary file.
member.param: Optional output stream for reporting progress while reading the data table.
member.returns: The number of records copied to the binary table

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.GisdkDataTranslator.Connection
member.summary: The input database connection.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.GisdkDataTranslator.OutputFile
member.summary: The output binary file.

member.name: P:GisdkDataAdapter.GisdkDataTranslator.QueryString
member.summary: The SQL query secifying the data table to copy.

member.name: T:CaliperForm.Gisdk
member.summary: This class provides a dynamic interface to the GISDK. Assign objects of this class to a dynamic variable and then call any GISDK function. Also call GISDK macros and create GISDK objects.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Gisdk.WithAlternateInterface(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a Gisdk new instance with which can be used to execute macros and create objects from a different UI Database.
member.param: Full path the the UI Database.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Gisdk.Macro(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes a GISDK macro in a compiled module (UIDatabase).
member.param: Name of the macro in the UIDatabase associated with this instance
Input arguments required by the macro.
member.returns: The object returned by the macro.
member.remarks: Throws a GisdkRuntimeException if a GISDK error occurs during the execution of the macro.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.Gisdk.CreateObject(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of a GISDK class in a compiled module (UIDatabase).
member.param: Name of the GISDK class in the UIDatabase associated with this instance
Input arguments required by the init macro of the class.
member.returns: The object instance.
member.remarks: Throws a GisdkRuntimeException if a GISDK error occurs during the creation of the object.

member.name: T:CaliperForm.GisdkConnectionException
member.summary: Thrown when the underlying connection to the mapping server is broken.

member.name: T:CaliperForm.GisdkRuntimeException
member.summary: Thrown when an error is raised udring the execution of a GISDK function or macro.

member.name: T:CaliperForm.GisdkValue
member.summary: Instances of this class provide a dynamic interface to the compound variables and other special GISDK types that may be returned by GISDK functions and macros. Assign the object to a dynamic variable and then access its properties. Also call methods on GISDK objects.

member.name: P:CaliperForm.GisdkValue.GisdkType
member.summary: Get the name of the GISDK type of this object,
member.returns: The type name (the same values returned by the TypeOf() GISDK function)

member.name: T:CaliperForm.OptionsArray
member.summary: Instances of this class provide a dictionary-like interface to GISDK options arrays and can be passed to GISDK functions and macros which expect options arrays as arguments.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new empty OptionsArray.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.#ctor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Create a new OptionsArray from any object that can be represented as an array of arrays.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.#ctor(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Create a new OptionsArray from a object that implements IDictionary.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.#ctor(System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Create a new OptionsArray from a Hashtable.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.AddMultiElementOption(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Add an option with more than one associated value.
member.param: The option name
The option values as separate arguments

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the OptionsArray object contains an option with the specified name.
member.param: The option name

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.ToArray
member.summary: Returns an array of arrays containing the option names and values.

member.name: M:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.ToDictionary
member.summary: Returns a Dictionary object containing the option names and values.
member.remarks: Throws an InvalidOperationException if this object contains any options with multiple values.

member.name: P:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Access the value for the specified key
member.param: The option name

member.name: P:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.Keys
member.summary: Get a list of all option names.

member.name: P:CaliperForm.OptionsArray.Count
member.summary: Get the total number of options.

member.name: T:Remote.Counter
member.summary: Thread-safe counter class that can be used to increment counters that are shared across all mapping applications running on this computer.

member.name: M:Remote.Counter.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Returns True.

member.name: M:Remote.Counter.GetCounter(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Ceate a new counter by name
member.param: globally unique counter name
maximum value that can be stored in this counter

member.name: M:Remote.Counter.GetNextValue
member.summary: Get the next value for this counter. Loops between 1 and the size of this counter

member.name: M:Remote.Counter.GetValue
member.summary: Get the current value for this counter.
member.returns: A value between 0 and size -1

member.name: M:Remote.Counter.Reset
member.summary: Get the next value and reset the counter to zero

member.name: T:Remote.Tickets
member.summary: Thread-safe queue data structure with IDs and timestamps for sharing objects across applications.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.GetTickets(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a handle of a Ticket queue by name. Returns true.
Dim X As Tickets X = New Tickets() X.GetTickets("Ticket List Name")

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Returns True. Indicates that Caliper.Web.Tickets are thread-safe

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.GetTicket
member.summary: Creates and add a new Ticket to the list, returns its value

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.Add(Remote.Ticket)
member.summary: Add a specific new Ticket at the end of the list, returns its position in the list

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.Remove(Remote.Ticket)
member.summary: Remove an existing Ticket from the list. Returns its position. Returns -1 if not found.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.IndexOf(Remote.Ticket)
member.summary: Get position of Ticket in list. Returns -1 if not found.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.GetValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the Ticket located at a specific index in the list. Returns an empty Ticket if Index is more than the list count.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.SetValue(System.Int32,Remote.Ticket)
member.summary: Set an existing Ticket to a new value, and returns what was the old Ticket stored in the same position. The Ticket will be replaced if Index is less than the current list count.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of tickets in the list.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.First
member.summary: Returns the first Ticket in the list

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.ToArray
member.summary: Returns an array list copy of the list

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.Describe
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this list

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.ToXML
member.summary: Returns an XML string representation of this list.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.Refresh(Remote.Ticket)
member.summary: Refresh the timestamp for a Ticket. Returns the new Ticket value with a new timestamp and the same ID.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.ClearAll
member.summary: Remove all elements from the list and resets the list ID counter to zero. Returns an array of tickets that is a copy of the removed list.

member.name: M:Remote.Tickets.Clear(System.Double)
member.summary: Remove all elements for which the timestamp is older than now - interval Returns an array copy of the tickets. The non-null tickets of the array are the ones that have been removed from the list. If no Ticket can be removed, this method will return Nothing.

member.name: T:Remote.Ticket
member.summary: Data structure that stores unique IDs and timestamps.

member.name: F:Remote.Ticket.ID
member.summary: Unique ID for this Ticket

member.name: F:Remote.Ticket.TimeStamp
member.summary: Time-stamp that specifies when this Ticket was issued.

member.name: M:Remote.Ticket.SetTicket(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary:
Creates a new Ticket structure (value type) with an ID (System.Int32) and a TimeStamp (double). You can access the structure fields with the dot notation:
Dim X As Ticket Dim Y As Ticket Y = New Ticket() X.ID = Y.ID X.TimeStamp = Y.TimeStamp

member.name: M:Remote.Ticket.TimeDifference(Remote.Ticket,Remote.Ticket)
member.summary: Returns the timestamp difference between Ticket1 and Ticket2, assuming Ticket2 comes AFTER Ticket1

member.name: M:Remote.Ticket.ToXML
member.summary: Returns an XML string representation of this Ticket with ID and TimeStamp attributes.

member.name: M:Remote.Ticket.Describe
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this Ticket with ID and TimeStamp attributes.

member.name: M:Remote.Ticket.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary:
Returns:
Less than zero - This instance is less than other obj. Zero - This instance is equal to other obj. Greater than zero - This instance is greater than other obj.
